GamepadButton.summary: The GamepadButton interface defines an individual button of a gamepad or other controller, allowing access to the current state of different types of buttons available on the control device.

remarks.para: A GamepadButton object is returned by querying any value of the array returned by the buttons property of the interface.

GamepadButtonTouched.summary:
The touched property of the
interface returns a boolean indicating whether
a button capable of detecting touch is currently touched (true) or not touched (false).

remarks.para: If the button is not capable of detecting touch but can return an analog value, the property will be true if the value is greater than 0, and false otherwise. If the button is not capable of detecting touch and can only report a digital value, then it should mirror the property.

GamepadButtonValue.summary:
The GamepadButton.value property of the
interface returns a double value used to represent the
current state of analog buttons on many modern gamepads, such as the triggers.

remarks.para:
The values are normalized to the range 0.0 â€” 1.0, with
0.0 representing a button that is not pressed, and 1.0 representing a
button that is fully pressed.

GamepadButtonPressed.summary:
The GamepadButton.pressed property of the
interface returns a boolean indicating whether
the button is currently pressed (true) or unpressed (false).
